intro: Neowimmeria niihauensis var. forbesii, commonly known as the Niihau daisy, is a rare flowering plant native to the Hawaiian island of Niihau. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal habitats, thriving in sandy soils and dry conditions. It has small, narrow leaves and is known for its ornamental value. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
